Enumeration Type Documentation

enum wapi_route_target_t

Route target types.

Enumerator:
WAPI_ROUTE_TARGET_NET 

The target is a network.

WAPI_ROUTE_TARGET_HOST 

The target is a host.

Definition at line 299 of file network.c.

int wapi_get_routes ( wapi_list_t *  list  ) 

Parses routing table rows from WAPI_PROC_NET_ROUTE.

Parameters:
[out] list Pushes collected wapi_route_info_t into this list.

Below is example usage of wapi_get_routes().

static void
getroutes(void)
{
    wapi_list_t list;

    bzero(&list, sizeof(wapi_list_t));
    if (wapi_get_routes(&list) >= 0)
    {
        wapi_route_info_t *ri;

        /* print route */
        for (ri = list.head.route; ri; ri = ri->next)
            printf(
                ">> dest: %s, gw: %s, netmask: %s\n",
                inet_ntoa(ri->dest), inet_ntoa(ri->gw), inet_ntoa(ri->netmask));

        /* free routes */
        ri = list.head.route;
        while (ri)
        {
            wapi_route_info_t *tmpri;

            tmpri = ri->next;
            free(ri->ifname);
            free(ri);
            ri = tmpri;
        }
    }
}

Here is a sample output of the above getroutes().

>> dest: 0.0.0.0, gw: 0.0.0.0, netmask: 0.0.0.0
>> dest: 192.168.1.0, gw: 192.168.1.0, netmask: 192.168.1.0
